description: Erection of single storey rear extension (4.0m in depth, maximum height of 3.0m and eaves height of 3.0m)
decision_conditions: The proposed extension would extend beyond a wall forming a side elevation of the original dwellinghouse, and would have a width greater than half the width of the original dwellinghouse, in conflict with Paragraph A.1 (j) (iii).

In dealing with the application the Council has implemented the requirement in the National Planning Policy Framework to work with the applicant in a positive and proactive way.  We have made available detailed advice in the form or our statutory policies in the Core Strategy, Supplementary Planning Documents, Planning Briefs and other informal written guidance, as well as offering a full pre-application advice service, in order to ensure that the applicant has been given every opportunity to submit an application which is likely to be considered favourably.
Please provide the corresponding, previously approved drawings marked as 'approved' or otherwise clearly identifiable.

Inspection:Site inspection carried out as a desktop exercise with information provided by the applicant as supporting material to application.Assessment:Emergency removal warranted given the advanced state of decay and the partial collapse.Recommendation:Approve and require replacement.
